title: When running vagrant up on an already existing VM it fails to load json from samba share
body:
### Vagrant version
2.0.2 and 2.0.3

### Host operating system
Windows
### Guest operating system
Irrelevant

### metadata_url file in ~/.vagrant.d/boxes/< some string >/
file:////somesmbshare/foo-bar.json

### Debug output
Providing a snippet of the relevant debug log instead of a gist:
```
 INFO interface: output: ==> default: Checking if box 'FOO/bar' is up to date...
==> default: Checking if box 'FOO/bar' is up to date...
 INFO downloader: Downloader starting download: 
 INFO downloader:   -- Source: file://somesmbshare/foo-bar.json
 INFO downloader:   -- Destination: C:/Users/abcdefg/AppData/Local/Temp/vagrant-load-metadata20180329-10476-dwhheh

...

DEBUG subprocess: stderr: * Invalid file://hostname/, expected localhost or 127.0.0.1 or none
* Closing connection -1
curl: (3) Invalid file://hostname/, expected localhost or 127.0.0.1 or none
```

### Expected behavior
The json file is pulled from the network share

### Actual behavior
The json file is not pulled from the network share.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Put a json descriptor on an smbshare.
2. Point the metadata_url file at this smbshare
3. Run `vagrant up`

### Alternative Steps to reproduce
1. Put a json descriptor on an smbshare.
2. Run `vagrant up` to bring up a new box

### Attempted Workaround
If you use 6 forwardslashes (file://////somesmbshare/foo-bar.json) it gets you past the error above, however it then errors with the following:
```
 INFO interface: output: ==> default: Checking if box 'FOO/bar' is up to date...
==> default: Checking if box 'FOO/bar' is up to date...
 INFO downloader: Downloader starting download: 
 INFO downloader:   -- Source: file:////somesmbshare/foo-bar.json
 INFO downloader:   -- Destination: C:/Users/abcdefg/AppData/Local/Temp/vagrant-load-metadata20180329-10476-dwhheh

...

DEBUG subprocess: stderr: * SMB shares are not supported in file: URLs.
* Closing connection -1
curl: (3) SMB shares are not supported in file: URLs.
```

It appears the update from curl 7.56.0 to 7.57.0 has broken smb support in file URLs. The offending commit in curl is https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/25634611f983824503cd708f0b65dddf028c3026
Unfortunately, vagrant appends "file:" in front of virtually anything you give it that isn't a web url, so we can't use whatever curl expects an smb share to look like ("//somesmbshare/foo-bar.json" perhaps?)

### Working Workaround
Go back to 2.0.1 where it worked to use an smb share in a file: URL.
